title: Sorcery deserves to be the next tree to get an extra keystone
body:
As a mage, choosing between present keystones just feels so wrong. Either you have the kit to be able take something outside of sorcery, either you are stuck with Aery and Comet (Phase rush just feels decent for people that aren't mages and {{champion:69}} {{champion:136}} ). When you take a look at them, Comet and Aery literally does the SAME thing; one just has less chance to hit but have better damage, while the other has less damage and always hit, along with having a small bonus with shields. Some mages like {{champion:101}} feels right at home with only those two, but with things like {{champion:38}} ,{{champion:90}}  or {{champion:112}} , it feels like you could have sooooo much better, but you are stuck with those poor choices.

Please, the mana changes will already hit pretty hard most mages, at least give them the diversity of usable keystones that most champ classes had from the start.

balancing all dots around a keystone is bad
Yeah, and so was Fervor of Battle and its ability to dictate whether bruisers would be viable or not, depending on how strong it is.
Except they stated why they removed it.

also physical casters with sustained spell damage patterns could use a keystone in sorcery too.

{{champion:86}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:58}} etc. could use a keystone like that. what if we just made something like {{champion:63}} passive, that stacks up on the enemy over a couple of seconds of taking spell damage and at full stacks gets exploded with the next auto attack?

something like


> #DEATHFIRE TOUCH
> dealing spell damage applies deathfire touch to enemy champions. debuffed enemies take 3 - 20 (scaling with level) adaptive damage over two seconds.

> after 6 seconds of a target being debuffed, the next auto attack against the target deals x (scales with ad and ap) amount of adaptive damage. melee champions stack the debuff twice as fast.

the dot on its own deals very little damage/second, but if you trigger it, its basically an aery proc worth of damage, after which the stacks reset to 1 and have to be built up again to get the next proc. similar to how grasp stacks up until its ready every 4 seconds.

ranged champions take 6 seconds to stack the proc on an opponent. melee champions only take 3 seconds.

it would support sustained spell damage patterns of ad and ap casters, while it has some interactivity to it with the requirement of triggering the keystone when its stacked up, to get worthwile damage out of it.

its important, that we dont just make it a keystone that deals a shitload of damage for {{champion:90}} pressing e or {{champion:25}} pressing w from range and then walking backwards, but at the same time it should still support these kind of champions in extended fights. so if they stay and auto attack to trigger the proc, they get the extra damage.
But darius is at home with conqueror and phase and renekton (I believe) one proc pta with just empowered w

To be fair. Aery on riven isn't complete garbage.

tbh as a Xerath player I'm sad that Aery takes longer to come back with longer range, and comet is better when you constantly hit single target spells, or are a burst mage who uses CC first (like Lux)

But why don't viktor, kass and malzahar work with Aery?? imo they'd work with it better than Xerath

For Malz I hate aery because you only get half of the keystone, and the half you get isn't some thing you really want. The poke given by aery and comet are useless when the only thing your champion is good for is shoving the lane and roaming with ult. By the time you get enough items to hurt the damage those 2 runes do is non existent. It's better to just have a shorter flash cd

Hmm, so we want something that helps the champions with repeated ticks but won't excessively be applied to other classes like ADC and Tanks? And we want a keystone that isn't replicated by an item so something like Liandry's buff is out (as that would've been my idea).

How's about this: 
For every ability-based instance of damage you land on a target, they're inflicted with a stack of X for a short time, up to a maximum of 3 stacks. 
When a DoT effect is inflicted by an ability (not ignite or items), these 3 stacks are triggered and amplify the DoT damage in some way (percent increase of damage, partial true damage, lower MR/Armor per tick) that hopefully scales as that's what is currently lacking?

I think the main issue with DoT champions is they're quite varied if you think about it.
{{champion:63}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:122}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:68}} 
These are typically the big examples of DoTs and each of them have fairly different purposes in the game- which I imagine is one reason a *good* DoT-based keystone might be hard to come by.

Already I see a slight issue in that not all of them can trigger my idea, Teemo only technically has one damage-based ability for example, E is only auto-attacks. Perhaps so long as you keep inflicting damage on the enemy champion, stacks won't fade?

I don’t know, at least you’ve got 2 choices in Sorcery. Domination you’ve got electrocute which is great on some champs, ten Predator which is only
Good on a handful of champs, and dark harvest which is decent at best on like 2 or 3.

I agree, and the worst thing is that Riot had said that their next rune is probably going to be in the domination path since they want "more people to pick the domination path". Like Assassin's aren't being buffed enough already lol.

But if it's going to be a rune that would not be targetted towards Assassins specifically and more towards other champion classes then i'm down for it.
Why should someone go Sorcery on {{champion:38}} , Thunderlord is much better
I would kill for some kind of Health sustain
Resolve or domination secondary is your sustain.

I kinda agree just the challenge is the keystone has add somehow without being the clear choice. Because one duh choice isn't better than say three or more meh imo.

The sub runes in sorcery have been good enough to make up for it (or used to be?)

It'd probably be easier to make stormsurge more appealing or make aery less.. generally lame in effect

I had an idea a while back where Aery was changed so that instead of just being a glorified scorch, the target that Aery is attached to doesn't get damaged but rather takes a little extra damage from subsequent abilities for the duration, like 2 seconds or whatever. So then on an ally, it's slight damage reduction for 2 seconds. 

I think that could fill a nice niche for mages that aren't quite dps based but aren't ap assassins that need the burst from electrocute.
